title: How to Unlock TracFone Mobile Phones

steps.title: Call TracFone.
steps.content: Call TracFone. Contact customer service at 1-800-867-7183 between 8:00am and 11:45pm, Eastern Time (ET), 7 days a week. [1] X Research source If you did not buy your phone through TracFone, it is likely unlocked already, and no code is needed.

steps.title: Request an unlock code for your phone.
steps.content: Request an unlock code for your phone. The representative will verify that your phone and account meet all the necessary conditions to be unlocked . [2] X Research source TracFone's unlock policy is available here .

steps.title: Write down the code.
steps.content: Write down the code. You will need to have the 10 to 15-digit unlock code handy when you unlock your device. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Get a SIM card.
steps.content: Get a SIM card. Contact the carrier you want to switch to for a new SIM card.

steps.title: Power off the device.
steps.content: Power off the device. Shut down your phone as you normally would.

steps.title: Remove the TracFone SIM card.
steps.content: Remove the TracFone SIM card. Depending on which device you're using, the SIM card will be in a slot on the side of the case, under the back cover, or under the battery. [4] X Research source Different phones require different methods for removing and replacing a SIM card. Learn to Switch SIM Cards on your phone.

steps.title: Replace the SIM card.
steps.content: Replace the SIM card. Insert the SIM card from your new carrier into the slot. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Power on your phone.
steps.content: Power on your phone. Instead of your normal home screen, you'll get a notification that your phone needs to be unlocked before it can use the installed SIM card.

steps.title: Enter the unlock code.
steps.content: Enter the unlock code. Use the keypad to type in the code you got from the TracFone representative.

steps.title: Press OK.
steps.content: Press OK . You'll see a confirmation message confirming that the code has been accepted. Now you can use your Android phone with your new carrier.
